server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Server class for hosting games for several players.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wouter Bezemer, Wiljan Vinke

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Constructs a new Server object.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Start een Server-applicatie op.

      • run

        public void run()
        Listens to a port of this Server if there are any Clients that would like to connect. For every new socket connection a new ClientHandler thread is started that takes care of the further communication with the Client.

      • getHandlers

        public java.util.List<ClientHandler> getHandlers()

      • print

        public void print(java.lang.String message)

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends a message using the collection of connected ClientHandlers to all connected Clients.
        Parameters:
        msg - message that is send

      • addHandler

        public void addHandler(ClientHandler handler)
        Add a ClientHandler to the collection of ClientHandlers.
        Parameters:
        handler - ClientHandler that will be added

      • removeHandler

        public void removeHandler(ClientHandler handler)
        Remove a ClientHandler from the collection of ClientHandlers.
        Parameters:
        handler - ClientHandler that will be removed

      • getTurn

        public int getTurn()
        Checks the player whose turn it currently is in the game.
        Returns:
        the ClientHandler whose turn it is. Returns null if there is no game yet

      • getGame

        public Game getGame()
        Returns the current Game on the Server.
        Returns:
        the game in session
